homeContent.hero_subtitle: Broadcasting the heartbeat of the city of Akure, 24/7 on 99.1 FM

aboutContent.header_subtitle: Broadcasting excellence since 2024, bringing you the heartbeat of the city through music, conversation, and community connection.
story_paragraphs:
The Station That Refused to Be Average.
Some radio stations arrive quietly. They tiptoe into town, whisper their presence, and hope listeners eventually notice them.
Glow FM 99.1 Akure did the opposite.
Glow FM 99.1 was officially opened on February 21, 2024, and by March 2024, it began broadcasting with the kind of urgency that sounded like destiny. Not as a “new station trying to find its voice,” but as a station that already knew what it came to do: wake the city up, shake the airwaves, and become unforgettable.

And the location? That alone reads like a statement.
Glow FM sits in a compound at Ijapo estate an iconic compound once owned by Chief Gani Fawehinmi, SAN a man whose name carries weight, courage, and a stubborn refusal to accept mediocrity. There’s something poetic about it. A place once associated with fearless truth now housing a new kind of power: a voice that reaches the people daily, directly, and relentlessly.

From the beginning, the station moved like a storm with a plan.
Glow FM wasn’t built on timid ideas. It was powered by vibrant employees young, hungry, creative minds with energy loud enough to travel through walls. The early days were intense, exciting, and fast. The kind of early days that separate stations that are playing radio… from stations that are becoming culture.

But growth never comes without heat.
Glow FM underwent many staff changes and not the cosmetic kind. These were changes that shaped character, refined standards, and demanded real professionalism. It was pressure and pruning. The station evolved in real time, learning what every great brand eventually learns:

You don’t build excellence by wishing.
You build it by enforcing it.
And that’s exactly what happened.
Through the shifts, the reshuffles, and the strengthening of its internal engine, Glow FM kept rising. The sound became tighter. The delivery became sharper. The identity became clearer.
Programming became more confident. The station began to feel less like a newcomer and more like a force that had always belonged at the top.

Then came the moment that confirmed what listeners already knew.
In December 2025, Glow FM 99.1 Akure won Radio Station of the Year in Ondo state.
Not by luck. Not by noise.
By growth. By grit. By doing the work when nobody was clapping.
That award wasn’t just a trophy. It was a stamp. Proof that what started in 2024 as a bold new signal had become, by 2025, an institution.

But Glow FM didn’t stop at radio. Because Glow FM is not just a station. It’s an ecosystem.
As the station continued to grow in leaps and bounds, it expanded into the spaces where modern audiences live. YouTube channels. Podcast studios. Digital content growth. Media innovation platforms. The Glow brand began moving beyond the FM dial and into the future, where audiences don’t just listen, they subscribe, share, comment, and connect.

Glow FM started building presence, not just broadcasts.
Because the truth is simple:
Radio is powerful.
But radio that evolves is unstoppable.
Glow FM 99.1 Akure represents something rare in a world full of recycled content and lazy ambition. It represents momentum. It represents the kind of brand that doesn’t beg for attention, it earns loyalty. The kind of station that understands that relevance is not a gift, it’s a discipline.

Opened in February 2024.
Broadcasting by March 2024.
Impactful from day one.
Refined through change.
Crowned Radio Station of the Year, December 2025.
And still rising.

Glow FM 99.1 isn’t just on air.

It’s on a mission.
aboutContent.mission_body: To deliver exceptional radio broadcasting that entertains, informs, and connects our community. We strive to be the voice of the people, celebrating local culture, music, and stories while maintaining the highest standards of quality and integrity in everything we do.
aboutContent.vision_body: To be the leading radio station that shapes cultural conversations, discovers new talent, and pioneers innovative broadcasting technologies. We envision a future where Glow FM continues to be the heartbeat of our community and a model for excellence in radio worldwide.

aboutContent.team_subtitle: The passionate team behind Glow FM's success

team.name: Dr Ezekiel Kayode Akande
team.bio:
Dr. Ezekiel Akande is a visionary leader, seasoned medical professional, and transformative communicator whose work bridges science, consciousness, and societal impact. A U.S.-trained anesthesiologist with over three decades of clinical experience, he brings the same precision, calm authority, and depth of insight from the operating theatre into leadership, media, and human development.

As the Chairman and driving force behind Glow 99.1 FM, Dr. Akande has built a tech-forward, community-centered radio institution that amplifies truth, inspiration, and progressive dialogue. Under his stewardship, Glow 99.1 FM has evolved beyond traditional broadcasting into a multimedia ecosystem—integrating radio, digital platforms, youth empowerment initiatives, and socially conscious programming—while remaining firmly rooted in local culture and values.

Dr. Akande is also a respected thought leader in New Age philosophy, spiritual wealth, and personal transformation. Through his writing, radio programs, and public engagement, he challenges individuals—especially Africans and the diaspora—to rethink success, align inner consciousness with outer achievement, and build wealth with purpose and integrity. His voice is reflective yet bold, practical yet deeply spiritual, offering clarity in a world often distracted by noise.

Known for his discipline, resilience, and unwavering belief in human potential, Dr. Ezekiel Akande stands as a rare blend of healer, strategist, and visionary. His life’s work is guided by a single conviction: that when knowledge, consciousness, and service align, individuals and communities do not merely survive—they rise.

team.name: Akinwumi Abodunde
team.bio:
Akinwumi Abodunde is a seasoned Nigerian broadcaster and media executive who was recently appointed as the General Manager of Glow 99.1 FM Akure in January 2026.
Career Highlights
Glow 99.1 FM: Appointed General Manager on January 19, 2026, to oversee strategic growth and audience expansion for the Akure-based station.
Ondo State Radiovision Corporation (OSRC): Served for over 25 years as an "ace journalist" and prominent news anchor, notably hosting the News @ 7. He officially "bowed out" of OSRC in July 2023.
FUTA Radio: Previously served as the Station Manager for FUTA Radio at the Federal University of Technology, Akure.

Awards: 
He has received multiple media honors, including awards from the Ondo State Media Group in recognition of his long-standing excellence in broadcasting. 

Personal Background
He is an alumnus of the Federal University of Technology, Akure (FUTA). 

He is widely recognized in Ondo State as a veteran of the broadcast industry, often described as a "gentleman per excellence" by colleagues and the media community.

team.name: Mojisola Oladele (arpa)
team.bio:
Mojisola Oladele (arpa) is a seasoned broadcaster of over 28 years experience.
She holds Higher National Diploma in Graphics Design from The Polytechnic Ibadan, Oyo State, Masters degree in Communication and Language Arts from the University of Ibadan. An Associate member, Advertising Regulatory Council of Nigeria (ARCON). 

Career Highlights
She worked with OSRC between 1997 and 2018 before her voluntary retirement as Chief Production Officer.

She had produced many documentaries of which she earned official commendation, produced programmes to include outside broadcast (OB) production, Praise Night, Armed Forces and remembrance day and Youth Platform.

Award
  • The Most Outstanding Member of Staff, OSRC - 2011.
    The most proficient Marketing personnel of the year - 2024.

She is currently the Senior Marketing Manager, Glow 99.1 FM, Ijapo Estate, Akure.

team.name: Oke Joshua Olutayo
team.bio:
Oke Joshua Olutayo is a highly skilled and dedicated broadcast engineer with over 14 years of hands-on professional experience in designing, operating, and maintaining high-performance audio systems for broadcast and live production environments. He possesses deep technical expertise in audio signal flow, sound reinforcement, mixing, and broadcast transmission standards, ensuring consistent delivery of clear, balanced, and high-fidelity sound across multiple platforms.


His proficiency includes the installation, calibration, troubleshooting, and preventive maintenance of broadcast equipment such as mixing consoles, microphones, transmitters, processors, and studio-to-transmitter links. Oke Joshua is also experienced in diagnosing complex technical faults under live broadcast conditions, implementing effective solutions to minimize downtime and maintain uninterrupted transmission. His strong understanding of acoustics, audio processing, and broadcast compliance enables him to deliver industry-standard sound quality while supporting seamless studio and field operations.


In recognition of his technical excellence and contribution to sound production, he was honored with the Best Music and Sound Engineer Award at the UKCDMA London Regional Film Festival in 2024, further affirming his professional competence and impact within the broadcast and audio engineering industry.

team.name: Comfort Omolafe
team.position: Ag. Head News and Current Affairs
team.bio:
Comfort Omolafe, popularly known as Queen Comfort Omolafe, is a multiple award-winning professional presenter, editor, newscaster, and journalist with nearly a decade of experience in broadcast journalism and public engagement.

She is widely recognized for her confident and engaging on-air presence across radio, television, and live stage events, where she also serves as a seasoned compere. Her work reflects a strong commitment to informative, people-centered programming and impactful storytelling.


Current Role – Glow 99.1 FM, Akure

Comfort Omolafe is a core on-air personality at Glow 99.1 FM Akure, where she hosts and anchors several flagship programmes, including:

  • Your View – Debuted in January 2025, airing Mondays at 3:00 PM

  • LET’S TALK – Mondays, 4:00 PM – 4:30 PM

  • Music While You Work – Tuesdays, 10:00 AM – 11:00 AM

  • Women’s World

  • Reading for Pleasure

  • Glow Health Talk with NMA

She also anchors religious and environmental programmes sponsored by corporate and institutional partners.


Television

Beyond radio, Comfort expanded her media footprint with the debut of “Chat Room with Omolafe Comfort” on Glow TV, further showcasing her versatility as a television host and interviewer.


Previous Experience

Before joining Glow FM, she spent almost seven years at Breez 91.9 FM, where she hosted the station’s highly popular current affairs programme, “Reporter’s Diary.” During her time there, she also presented several current affairs, personality, religious, and environmental programmes, establishing herself as a respected voice in broadcast journalism.

team.name: Oluwaremilekun Idowu
team.bio: Oluwaremilekun Idowu is a professional presenter, newscaster, and journalist with a strong passion for impactful storytelling, public engagement, and credible, people-centered reporting. She is known for her clear delivery, confident on-air presence, and commitment to journalistic integrity, ensuring that news is presented accurately and responsibly. With a deep sense of professionalism, she connects effectively with audiences while shedding light on issues that inform, educate, and inspire. Her work reflects a dedication to excellence in broadcast journalism and the ethical communication of information.

team.name: Mike ‘Femi Halim
team.bio: Mike Halim Obafemi, popularly known as MC Olumiko, is a dynamic and purpose-driven presenter and journalist with a sharp, confident voice for news delivery, in-depth interviews, and compelling real-time storytelling. He is deeply committed to truth, balance, and responsible journalism, using his platform to inform, educate, and engage audiences on issues that matter most. With a natural command of the microphone and a strong connection to listeners, he brings clarity, energy, and authenticity to every broadcast. His work reflects a passion for impact-driven media, ensuring that stories are not just told, but truly felt and understood.
